surface.zone:
my extinction because that I might not cause greater wretchedness; & if yet by in some mode unknown to me, youthou haste not ceased to think thou & feel, youthou desirest not my life for my own misery. Blasted as thou wert, my agony was still superior to thine: for the bitter sting of remorse may not cease to Rankle in my wounds, until death shall close them forever.
But soon, he cried with sad & solemn enthusi asm, I shall die, & what I now feel be no longer felt. . . Soon these burning miseries will be extinct. I shall ‸mounascend my funeral pile triumphantly; & exult in the agony of the torturing flames. The light of that conflagration will fade away. I know not My ashes will be swept into the sea by the winds. My spirit will sleep in peace; or if it thinks will surely not think thus. Adieu.
He sprung from the cabin-window, as he said this, upon an ice raft which lay close to the vessel; he was soon borne away by the waves, & lost in the darkness of distance.
